intro: Erodium chium var. soluntinum, commonly known as the Soluntine bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The species is part of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological characteristics.
